title: Pakistan, Azerbaijan sign landmark MoU to boost youth cooperation
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 01 (APP):In a significant development, Pakistan and Azerbaijan have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to strengthen bilateral cooperation in youth development.
The agreement aims to foster stronger ties between the two nations through youth-centered initiatives, intercultural exchange, and regional collaboration.
According to the statement issued by PMYP on Tuesday, representing Pakistan’s Prime Minister’s Youth Programme (PMYP), Member of the National Assembly and Focal Person for PMYP, Syeda Amnah Batool, signed the MoU on behalf of Chairman Mr. Rana Mashhood Ahmad Khan.
The agreement was signed with Azerbaijani counterparts during a formal ceremony.
This landmark partnership is rooted in shared goals and mutual understanding, paving the way for enhanced regional cooperation and youth development.
The MoU is expected to open new avenues for collaboration, exchange programs, and joint initiatives between Pakistan and Azerbaijan.
The signing of the MoU marks a significant step towards strengthening bilateral relations and promoting youth development in both countries.
